title: Web Development
description: Test your knowledge of HTML, CSS, and web concepts

questions.explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language, which is the standard markup language for creating web pages.

questions.text: Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
questions.explanation: The 'color' property is used to specify the color of text in CSS.

questions.text: Select all valid HTML5 semantic elements:
questions.explanation: header, article, section, and footer are semantic elements introduced in HTML5. container and content are not standard HTML elements.

questions.text: The CSS 'box-sizing: border-box' property includes padding and border in the element's total width and height.
questions.explanation: When box-sizing is set to border-box, the padding and border are included in the element's total width and height calculations.

questions.text: What is the correct HTML for creating a hyperlink?
questions.explanation: The <a> tag with the href attribute is used to create hyperlinks in HTML.

questions.text: Identify the issue in this CSS code:
questions.explanation: There's a missing semicolon after 'height: 100px'. In CSS, each declaration should end with a semicolon.

questions.text: Which CSS display property makes an element a flex container?
questions.explanation: Setting display: flex creates a flex container, enabling flexbox layout for its children.

questions.text: Select all ways to include CSS in an HTML document:
questions.explanation: CSS can be included via external stylesheets (<link>), internal stylesheets (<style>), and inline styles. The <css> tag and import statement in HTML are not valid methods.

questions.text: What is the purpose of the alt attribute in an tag?
answers: To make the image load faster
To provide alternative text when the image cannot be displayed
questions.explanation: The alt attribute provides alternative text that is displayed when the image cannot be loaded or for accessibility purposes.

questions.text: Which of these units are relative units in CSS?
questions.explanation: em (relative to parent font size), rem (relative to root font size), and vh (relative to viewport height) are relative units. px and pt are absolute units.
